name: Node.js Basics Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of the basics of Node.js.

questions.questionText: What is Node.js?
What is the purpose of the Node Package Manager (npm)?
options: To install and manage Node.js packages

questions.questionText: What is a callback function in Node.js?
options: A function that is called before the main function
A function that is called after the main function
A function that is called at a specific time interval
A function that is passed as an argument to another function and is called when that function completes

name: Node.js Web Development Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of web development with Node.js.

questions.questionText: What is Express.js?
What is the purpose of the EJS templating engine?
options: To generate HTML markup with dynamic content

questions.questionText: What is middleware in the context of Node.js?
options: A function that is executed before or after a request is handled

name: Node.js Advanced Concepts Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of advanced concepts in Node.js.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the Cluster module in Node.js?
options: To create a cluster of web servers

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the Stream module in Node.js?
options: To read and write data in chunks

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the Child Process module in Node.js?

name: Advanced Node.js Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of advanced Node.js concepts.

questions.questionText: What is the difference between the 'require' and 'import' statements in Node.js?
options: The 'require' statement is used to import built-in modules, while 'import' is used to import external modules
'import' is used to import built-in modules, while 'require' is used to import external modules
'import' is a newer syntax introduced in ES6, while 'require' is an older syntax

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'util' module in Node.js?
options: To provide access to low-level system information
To provide common utility functions that can be used throughout an application

questions.questionText: What is an event loop in Node.js?
options: A loop that waits for events to occur and then executes the associated callback functions
A loop that runs continuously and never stops
A loop that is used to manage network connections

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'cluster' module in Node.js?
options: To provide a way to run Node.js in a distributed environment
To manage multiple Node.js processes on a single machine
To provide access to low-level system information

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'crypto' module in Node.js?
options: To provide common utility functions that can be used throughout an application
To provide cryptographic functionality such as hashing, encryption, and decryption

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'process' object in Node.js?
options: To provide access to low-level system information
To provide information about the Node.js process and its environment

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'path' module in Node.js?
options: To provide access to low-level system information
To provide utilities for working with file and directory paths

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'http' module in Node.js?
options: To provide common utility functions that can be used throughout an application
To provide access to low-level system information

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'fs' module in Node.js?
options: To provide common utility functions that can be used throughout an application
To provide access to low-level system information

questions.questionText: What is Node.js?
What is NPM?
What is the difference between a callback function and a promise?
options: A callback function is a function that is called once a certain task has been completed, while a promise represents a value that may not be available yet but will be at some point in the future
A promise is a function that is called once a certain task has been completed, while a callback function represents a value that may not be available yet but will be at some point in the future
A callback function is used to handle errors, while a promise is used to handle successful outcomes

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'async' and 'await' keywords in JavaScript?
options: To handle errors in a try-catch block
To write asynchronous code that looks synchronous

questions.questionText: What is middleware in the context of Node.js?
options: A piece of software that sits between a database and a server
A library that helps you build user interfaces
A function that runs between the request and response objects in a server
A tool used to optimize database performance

questions.questionText: What is Express.js?
options: A back-end JavaScript framework for building web applications

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'body-parser' middleware in Express.js?
What is the purpose of the 'cors' middleware in Express.js?
What is the difference between 'let' and 'var' in JavaScript?
options: 'let' is used to declare constants, while 'var' is used to declare variables
'var' is a newer syntax introduced in ES6, while 'let' is an older syntax
